item.title: Ann add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Ann add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "I'm inspired by the people I meet in my travels--hearing their stories, seeing the hardships they overcome, their fundamental optimism and decency. I'm inspired by the love people have for their children. And I'm inspired by my own children, how full they make my heart. They make me want to work to make the world a little bit better. And they make me want to be a better man." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Ann add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Perhaps I write for no one. Perhaps for the same person children are writing for when they scrawl their names in the snow." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Ann add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "I would like to be the air that inhabits you for a moment only. I would like to be that unnoticed and that necessary." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Ann add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Don't let the bastards grind you down." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Ann add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "That's why I write, because life never works except in retrospect. You can't control life, at least you can control your version." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Ann add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "Literature and butterflies are the two sweetest passions known to man." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Ann add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "The pages are still blank, but there is a miraculous feeling of the words being there, written in invisible ink and clamoring to become visible" -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Ann add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "I think it is all a matter of love; the more you love a memory the stronger and stranger it becomes" -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Ann add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "Literature was not born the day when a boy crying "wolf, wolf" came running out of the Neanderthal valley with a big gray wolf at his heels; literature was born on the day when a boy came crying "wolf, wolf" and there was no wolf behind him." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Ann add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "We write to taste life twice, in the moment and in retrospect." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Ann add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Ann add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "She feels in italics and thinks in CAPITALS." -- Henry James

item.title: Ann add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can warm me, I know that is poetry. If I feel physically as if the top of my head were taken off, I know that is poetry. These are the only ways I know it. Is there any other way?" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Ann add a quote by Emily Dickinson
